questions.question: Avoid using too dark a tint on your car. It can already affect your driving, especially if it is dark on the road.
questions.questionFilipino: Iwasang gumamit ng masyadong madilim na tint sa iyong sasakyan. Maaari na itong makaapekto sa iyong pagmamaneho, lalo na kung madilim sa kalsada.

questions.question: What type of road crash was caused by the driver's vices and revelry the night before the trip?
questions.questionFilipino: Anong klaseng road crash ang dulot ng mga bisyo at pagsasaya ng driver sa gabi bago ang trip?

questions.question: It is an acronym that you must remember and thoroughly inspect before operating your vehicle.
questions.questionFilipino: Ito ay isang acronym na dapat mong tandaan at masusing suriin bago paandarin ang iyong sasakyan.

questions.question: This is the first thing that you need to know to be a defensive driver.
questions.questionFilipino: Ito ang unang bagay na kailangan mong malaman upang maging defensive driver.

choices.choice: the proper use of the brake

finalExamBooklet.question: At an intersection with no traffic lights, two cars approach at right angles to east other, which driver must yield?
finalExamBooklet.answer: The driver of the vehicle that arrived there last

finalExamBooklet.question: With ABS (Anti-lock Braking System) installed on our vehicle, what should you do while driving with maximum speed and you have to stop suddenly?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Apply brakes gently with steady pressure

finalExamBooklet.question: What should you do when an oncoming vehicle deliberately crosses the centerline to pass another vehicle?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Be alert and be ready to slow down or stop if necessary

finalExamBooklet.question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you too close?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slow down gradually and give him he signal to overtake you

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the penalty if a driver is convicted of a crime while using a motor vehicle?
finalExamBooklet.answer: The Driver's License will be revoked and the driver will pay a fine

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the penalty if a driver is found to have a fake counterfeit license?
finalExamBooklet.answer: His/her driver's license shall be confiscated and he/she shall be disqualified from being granted a driver's license and driving a motor vehicle for a period of one (1) year from the payment of monetary fine

finalExamBooklet.question: An applicant for Professional driver's license should be at least ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: 18 years old

finalExamBooklet.question: A Public Utility Vehicle can only be driven by a holder of a ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: professional license

finalExamBooklet.question: Who is a Professional Driver?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Any driver who is paid or hired for operating a motor vehicle

finalExamBooklet.question: Drinking alcohol before driving is one of the major causes of vehicular road crash because when a driver is drunk he is ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: Arrogant, talkative and doesn't have the judgement and the reflexes to perform things safely

finalExamBooklet.question: Your speed while driving at night should depend on:
finalExamBooklet.answer: The physical, mental condition and skill of the driver and the road worthiness of the motor vehicle and weather condition

finalExamBooklet.question: In case of a road crash resulting to physical injury, the first duty of the involved driver is to:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Attend to the injured person and call for help

finalExamBooklet.question: When approaching a sharp curve of the highway, you should:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Reduce speed before entering the curve

finalExamBooklet.question: What does the law require you to do upon approaching an intersection with a stop sign?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Stop and proceed when it is safe to do so

finalExamBooklet.question: LTO rules and regulations prohibits drivers of public utility vehicles from:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Overcharging fares and fast taximeters and cutting trip or going beyond authorized line

finalExamBooklet.question: Where do you need to turn your wheels when parking uphill with a curb?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Away from the curb

finalExamBooklet.question: How many days do you need to settle a traffic violation with LTO?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Within 15 days

finalExamBooklet.question: Before changing lanes in traffic, aside from giving signal and checking your side and rearview mirrors, what else do you need to do?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Turn your head to check other vehicles beside your car

finalExamBooklet.question: Upon approaching an intersection, what should you do if you found out that the roadway beyond is blocked with traffic?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Stop before the intersection and wait until the traffic ahead moves on

finalExamBooklet.question: This traffic sign means 'Yield the right of way':
finalExamBooklet.answer: Inverted triangle

finalExamBooklet.question: Night driving is difficult. We should do the following when a vehicle comes towards us at night:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Dim you lights by swithching to low beam to avoid causing glare to the other driver

finalExamBooklet.question: The Temporary Operator's Permit (TOP) authorizes the appreended driver to operate motor vehicle for a period not exceeding:
finalExamBooklet.answer: 72 hours

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the main purpose of traffic laws, rules and regulations?
finalExamBooklet.answer: To put order on the road

finalExamBooklet.question: At night, when approaching a curve or intersection with poor visibility, be sure to:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Flash your headlights to let pedestrians and oncoming motorists know that you are heading into the curve or intersection

finalExamBooklet.question: When a driver of a PUV refuses to render service or convey passengers, his license shall be:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Confiscated with a payment of fine

finalExamBooklet.question: After passing or overtaking another vehicle, you can safely move back into your original lane if:
finalExamBooklet.answer: You can see in the side-view mirror the overtaken car, OR you can see in the rear-view mirror the overtaken car

finalExamBooklet.question: Green light at an intersection means:
finalExamBooklet.answer: The vehicles on the other street are stopped

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the best safety rule when driving a motor vehicle?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Never insist on you right-of-way

finalExamBooklet.question: If you are parking uphill on a street without a curb, turn the wheels towards the
finalExamBooklet.answer: Edge of the road

finalExamBooklet.question: The blind spot is the area to your right or left that you do not see in the side view mirror, what will you do before you back up?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Turn your head, to see that the way is clear

finalExamBooklet.question: Normally, on a two-lane road, overtaking is allowed at the:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Left lane

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the maximum penalty for driving under the influence of liquor or prohibited drugs?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Perpetual revocation of license

finalExamBooklet.question: Parking is allowed if the vehicle is ____________
finalExamBooklet.answer: Beyond 4 meters of a fire hydrant

finalExamBooklet.question: Flashing yellow light means:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slowdown and proceed with caution

finalExamBooklet.question: Driving in heavy rains can be extremely dangerous because visibility is limited. What should you do?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Turn on your headlights and slow down or park at a safe place if situation is risky

finalExamBooklet.question: Sometimes, a driver passes through a busy street with so many pedestrians. Which of the following should a driver do?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slowdown and check for safety when passing through

finalExamBooklet.question: On long drive, you should be awake and alert. What should you do if you are tired or very sleepy?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Park at the safe area and take a few-minutes nap

finalExamBooklet.question: What should you do whenever you are driving on a highway having a lot of potholes?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Reduce speed

finalExamBooklet.question: Whenever you are driving and you have to make or answer a call on your cellular phone and you do not have a hands-free attachment you should:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Pull over to the side of the road at a safe location and make the call

finalExamBooklet.question: Road crash can be avoided if the drivers:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Follow traffic signs and pertinent traffic rules and regulations

finalExamBooklet.question: If you see a ball coming from behind a parked vehicle on city street, chances are a kid is following it, what will you do?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slow down

finalExamBooklet.question: The most effective way to deal with a tailgater is to:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slow down and let him pass

finalExamBooklet.question: When you come across a sign telling you 'ACCIDENT PRONE AREA' what should you do? '
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slow down and be more alert than usual

finalExamBooklet.question: Which of the following is not a safe place to overtake?
finalExamBooklet.answer: When approaching a bridge or upon a curve

finalExamBooklet.question: What should you do when an incoming vehicle is forced to cross the centerline to avoid hitting another vehicle which suddenly pulled out from the lane?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Be alert and be prepared to slow down and give way

finalExamBooklet.question: Drivers moving slower than other vehicles should use the:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Outer lane

finalExamBooklet.question: When do you have to make a complete full stop?
finalExamBooklet.answer: At a red traffic light

finalExamBooklet.question: Where do you need to stop at a red traffic light?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Stop before the stop line

finalExamBooklet.question: Ignoring traffic lights during late hours of the night could:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Involve you in a fatal road crash

finalExamBooklet.question: The proper hand signal for a right turn is:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Left arm held pointing upward

finalExamBooklet.question: The driver's license issued to a driver shall entitle him/he to operate
finalExamBooklet.answer: Only motor vehicle/s specified in the license

finalExamBooklet.question: What should you do when driving on mountain roads during night time?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Flick your dimmer switch every time you approach a blind curve

finalExamBooklet.question: Where should you turn your wheels when parking downhill with curb?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Into the curb or towards the side of the road

finalExamBooklet.question: Upon approaching an intersection marked with a yield sign, you are required to ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: Slowdown, then enter the intersection when the way is clear

finalExamBooklet.question: We must remember that driving on the shoulder of the road is prohibited. When driving going to the same direction, you may pass to the right of a moving car if _____
finalExamBooklet.answer: The highway has two or more lanes moving towards the same direction

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the meaning of double solid yellow line?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Never cross to pass another vehicle unless permitted

finalExamBooklet.question: When you intend to slow down or stop, you should:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Step on your brakes lightly to turn on your brake lights

finalExamBooklet.question: Single white broken line on a 2-way road means:
finalExamBooklet.answer: It separates traffic moving in opposite directions

finalExamBooklet.question: Passing sounds easy, but it takes judgement of time, distance and the performance of your car. Which area is usually not allowed to pass?
finalExamBooklet.answer: On a curve

finalExamBooklet.question: If you are driving in a continuity lane which ends ahead, what would you do first in order to merge in the highway without interfering other traffic?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Adjust your speed

finalExamBooklet.question: When may you lend your driver's license?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Under no circumstance

finalExamBooklet.question: At an intersection without stop or yield signs, two cars approach at right angles to each other at almost the same time, which driver must yield?
finalExamBooklet.answer: The motorist on the left

finalExamBooklet.question: It is more dangerous to drive at maximum speed limit at night than during daytime because ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: You cannot see too far ahead at night

finalExamBooklet.question: Before making a U-Turn you should ______
finalExamBooklet.answer: Check for traffic behind you and indicate your intentions with a left turn signal

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the meaning of a blue traffic light?
finalExamBooklet.answer: None, there is no blue traffic light

finalExamBooklet.question: Motorcyle riders must exercise care and ride prudently at all times. To do so, they are required to wear ______:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Standard protective helmet

finalExamBooklet.question: A good driver in order to meet one's social responsibilities of caring for others on the road should:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Always exercise care for other pedestrians and vehicles around

finalExamBooklet.question: Some signs are called “lane-use” signs. They appear to direct you into the correct lane as you reach the actual intersection. They are usually seen:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Before an intersection

finalExamBooklet.question: If you encounter an emergency vehicle (ambulance, fire trucks, police) with sirens on, what should you do?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Give way by pulling in to the left or right side of the road depending on the circumstances

finalExamBooklet.question: Coming from the roadside and your signal light is malfunctioning, you must roll down your window and must use this hand signal:
finalExamBooklet.questionFilipino: Kung ikaw ay papalabas mula sa gilid ng kalsada at ang iyong signal light ay depektibo, dapat mong ibaba ang salamin ng bintana at gamitin ang senyas na ito:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Extend left arm sideward

finalExamBooklet.question: A U-Turn is used to reverse direction. Ideally, which of the following is permitted?
finalExamBooklet.questionFilipino: Ang U-turn ay ginagamit upang pumunta sa kabilang direksiyon. Alin sa sumusunod ang pinahihintulutan?
finalExamBooklet.answer: When a motorist unintentionally entered a one-way street
finalExamBooklet.answerFilipino: di sinasadyang pagpasok sa kalsadang one way

finalExamBooklet.question: A driver while on a highway shall yield the right of way to:
finalExamBooklet.questionFilipino: Kapag nasa highway, magpapadaan/magbibigay ang drayber sa:
finalExamBooklet.answer: Pedestrians crossing on a crosswalk

finalExamBooklet.question: If your vehicle breaks down on the road, what should you do?
finalExamBooklet.questionFilipino: Kapag nasiraan ka ng sasakyan sa daan, ano ang gagawin mo?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Switch on the hazard warning lights and display an EWD at least 4m behind the stalled vehicle
finalExamBooklet.answerFilipino: pailawin ang hazard warning light at malagay ng EWD 10m man lamang sa likuran ng nakahintong sasakyan

finalExamBooklet.question: When the vehicle you are driving runs off the road or hits an electric post or a parked car, your most probable reason is:
finalExamBooklet.answer: You are driving too fast and you lost control of your vehicle

finalExamBooklet.question: Under R.A. 8750, Children must be properly restraint if they are:
finalExamBooklet.answer: 6 years old and below

finalExamBooklet.question: What documents should a driver carry all the time when he is driving?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Drivers's License, Certificate of Registration & Current Official Receipt (CR & OR)

finalExamBooklet.question: It refers to standardized test to initially assess & determine intoxication.
finalExamBooklet.answer: Field Sobriety Test

finalExamBooklet.question: What does Philippine Clean Air Act of 1999 (R.A. No. 8749) say?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Every citizen has the right to breathe clean air

finalExamBooklet.question: In a traffic direction & control, when both traffic lights & traffic enforcer are directing traffic, which will you follow to avoid confusion?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Traffic enforcer

finalExamBooklet.question: What is the meaning of “Yellow Box” in the middle of the intersection?
finalExamBooklet.answer: Keep intersection open
